business.headline: Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectWith the 7th Pay Commission ending in December 2025, what kind of salary hike can central government employees realistically expect under the 8th Pay Commission, and when will the money actually come? Let's have a look.

ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

Why some IPO stocks keep running for days after listing, explains Nithin KamathIPO stocks continuing to rise after listing may seem puzzling.  Nithin Kamath breaks down a technical reason that is often overlooked by retail investors.

entertainment.headline: Mrunal Thakur on balancing Hindi and Telugu cinema: I like pushing my boundaries Mrunal Thakur shared her perspective on balancing work between Hindi and Telugu cinema. While speaking to India Today, she emphasised her interest in taking on new challenges and expanding her horizons.

Agastya Nanda: Ikkis felt like my last chance to prove myself Agastya Nanda has said that his upcoming film 'Ikkis' felt like his last opportunity to prove himself, highlighting the significance of war-drama for him. 'Ikkis' also features late actor Dharmendra in a pivotal character.

Radhika Apte on seeking therapy, being dropped from a film over 3-4 kilos Radhika Apte spoke to India Today about losing a film role over just a few kilos — which pushed her to therapy. She highlighted the film industry's body image and weight issues.

Agastya Nanda on working with Dharmendra in Ikkis: He was always involved Agastya Nanda shared his experience of working with late actor Dharmendra in the upcoming war-drama 'Ikkis' (2026). The actor spoke to India Today, about sharing screen-space with Dharmendra.

James Cameron addresses Matt Damon's claim on turning down Avatar profit share James Cameron has responded to Matt Damon's claim about turning down a 10 percent share of 'Avatar', disputing the actor's widely circulated claim and clarifying his perspective on the matter.

Dhurandhar director Aditya Dhar says he finally feels seen, after copious praise from RGV Aditya Dhar's emotional response to Ram Gopal Varma's Dhurandhar review sparked a rare filmmaker-to-filmmaker exchange on influence, originality, and the evolving language of Indian cinema.

Exclusive: Inside K-drama Don't Call Me Ma'am with Kim Hee-seon, Han Hye-jin The South-Korean series 'Don't Call Me Ma'am', led by Kim Hee-seon, Han Hye-jin and Jin Seo-yeon, examines life after ambition and marriage, focusing on reinvention and emotional truth. Kim, in an interview with India Today, also expressed her desire to visit India in future.

Emily in Paris 5 review: Emily Cooper needs a reset, not another cityRelease Date:Thu Dec 18, 2025 Emily in Paris returns with familiar charm, exploring Emily Cooper's personal growth amid romantic and professional dilemmas in vibrant Paris and Rome. Despite a slow start, the season can make for a comforting watch for fans.

The Sheep Detectives trailer: Will shepherd Hugh Jackman's sheep solve a murder? The trailer of the mystery-comedy 'The Sheep Detectives', shows shepherd Hugh Jackman's sheep set to solve a murder mystery. The film also features Emma Thompson in a pivotal character.

Is Kartik Aaryan the masked Punjabi singer Talwiinder? Fans speculate Ahead of 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri' release, fans are noting the similarity in the physical appearance of Punjabi singer Talwiinder and Kartik Aaryan. The movie will hit theatres on December 25.

Barack Obama's 2025 movie recommendations: Sinners, Jay Kelly, Hamnet and more Former president Barack Obama maintained his yearly practice by publicly releasing his 2025 selections for favourite movies, books, and music. He has observed the tradition each December since his time in the White House.

Akshaye Khanna-Sunny Deol to reunite 29 years after Border on a Netflix film: Reports Akshaye Khanna and Sunny Deol are reportedly teaming up 29 years after Border. The two are believed to be in the best phase of their careers, after the success of Gadar 2 and Dhurandhar.

A Dhurandhar problem for India's liberals Dhurandhar is a milestone in filmmaking since we now have a film in which ideology is not only conveyed via blunt nationalism, but embedded within a technically assured and cinematically sophisticated work

Dhurandhar's Rakesh Bedi on claims of behaving inappropriately with Sara Arjun Rakesh Bedi, who plays Jameel Jamali in Dhurandhar, responded to social media criticism following claims about his interaction with co-star Sara Arjun during the trailer launch. He clarified that the moment was misunderstood.

Tanya Mittal's lift claim confirmed, fans clap back at haters Recent footage and multiple sources have verified Tanya Mittal's statement about having a lift in her Gwalior residence, a claim that sparked controversy during her appearance on Bigg Boss 19.

Roofman review: Channing Tatum surprises in a restrained true-crime taleRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 Roofman movie review: Roofman is a quiet crime drama that focusses on the complex character of Jeffrey Manchester, a troubled ex-military man who turns to crime out of desperation. The film's strength lies in its mood and performances, offering a reflective and restrained narrative that stands apart from typical thrillers.

Farrhana Bhatt credits grandfather for raising her fierce on his death anniversary 'Bigg Boss 19' first runner-up, Farrhana Bhatt honoured her late grandfather on his death anniversary, expressing gratitude for the way he raised her to be strong and resilient.

Ikkis releases final trailer, Dharmendra's fiery dialogue is the highlight The final trailer for the upcoming biographical film 'Ikkis', starring Agastya Nanda and directed by Sriram Raghavan, has been released. 'Ikkis' tells the story of Second Lieutenant Arun Khetarpal, India's youngest Param Vir Chakra recipient.

general news.headline: US launches Operation Hawkeye Strike after ISIS killed three Americans in SyriaUS forces launched Operation Hawkeye Strike in Syria against ISIS following a deadly Palmyra attack that killed three Americans. Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth confirmed heavy losses inflicted on ISIS fighters.

Extreme fog grips Delhi-NCR, visibility plunges; airport issues advisoryDelhi woke up to extreme fog and hazardous air quality, causing severe visibility issues and widespread travel disruptions. The city continues to battle dense smog and pollution, impacting daily life and flight operations.

Congress blocked Priyanka from speaking on Delhi pollution in Parliament: RijijuSharing his observations on Priyanka Gandhi, Kiren Rijiju said her presentation was balanced and more acceptable compared to other Opposition members, noting that she maintained control over her speech and did not create any problems through her remarks.

Will rock entire Bangladesh: What Osman Hadi's shooter boasted to his girlfriendHours before the fatal attack on anti-India leader Sharif Osman Hadi, the alleged shooter, Faisal Karim, told his girlfriend that "something was coming that would shake the entire country". The warning proved eerily true as Bangladesh is now reeling from violence ahead of crucial February 2026 elections.

Navi Mumbai Airport will unlock growth and global connectivity: Jeet AdaniIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Jeet Adani, Director – Airports, Adani Airports Holdings Ltd (AAHL), said the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Indians using rishwat to game H-1B programme, says US diplomat who served in IndiaIndian-origin US diplomat Mahvash Siddiqui, writing for an anti-immigration think tank, alleged that the H-1B visa programme has turned into a de facto immigration shortcut dominated by India. She claimed that unqualified Indian applicants use fraud and bribery to enter the US, even as she urged the US to pause the visa programme pending a full audit.

New Epstein document release features Bill Clinton, little mention of Donald TrumpThe US Justice Department released Epstein files naming Bill Clinton repeatedly but rarely mentioning Donald Trump, following a law forced by Congress, as scrutiny grows ahead of the 2026 midterms.

Osman Hadi killing: Why Dhaka media offices were attacked, set ablaze by mob?Mobs protesting anti-India leader Sharif Osman Hadi's killing ransacked and set fire to offices of Bangladeshi news outlets, Prothom Alo and The Daily Star. Dozens of journalists and staff were trapped amid smoke and fire for hours. Protesters accused the newspapers of being "Delhi's lapdog" and "Sheikh Hasina's enabler". But what's the whole truth?

Watch: Hardik applies ice pack to cameraman hit by his six in Ahmedabad T20IIndia vs South Africa: One of Hardik Pandya's five monstrous sixes struck a cameraman at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

Live: Osman Hadi to be buried next to Bangladesh's national poet todayBangladesh Protests Live Updates: Protests erupted across Bangladesh after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with thousands converging at Shahbag and accusing authorities of failing to protect him. Demonstrators chanted slogans and waved placards, many of them openly showing anti-India and anti–Sheikh Hasina sentiments. The unrest escalated into violence, with protesters vandalising the offices of Daily Prothom Alo and Daily Star. The Awami League's office in Rajshahi was also reportedly torched. Protests spread beyond the capital, with stone-pelting reported at the Indian Assistant High Commission in Chattogram. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

Knife-wielding attacker kills 3 in Taiwan, hurls smoke bombs at train stationThree people were killed and five injured when a knife-wielding attacker went on a rampage in central Taipei on Friday, before then dying during a police chase after falling from a building.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Video: Playing near home, boy, 5, kicked 'like a football' by man in BengaluruA five-year-old boy was injured after a passerby kicked him while he was playing near his grandmother's house in Bengaluru's Thyagarajanagar.

Suryakumar Yadav unlikely to continue as T20I captain after T20 World Cup: ReportThe BCCI is all set to announce India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad on Saturday, December 20. Captain Suryakumar Yadav, 35, is unlikely to continue beyond the biennial tournament, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

Watch: Journalist proposes live during Putin's marathon press conferenceA Russian journalist stunned viewers by proposing to his girlfriend during Vladimir Putin's live year-end press conference, drawing applause, a playful response from Putin, and later confirmation that she said yes.

TMC files police complaint after Amit Malviya compares Bangladesh unrest to BengalTMC filed a police complaint against BJP's Amit Malviya, accusing him of an inflammatory post comparing Islamist violence in Bangladesh with West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee, escalating pre-election political tensions.

Radhika Apte on seeking therapy, being dropped from a film over 3-4 kilosRadhika Apte spoke to India Today about losing a film role over just a few kilos — which pushed her to therapy. She highlighted the film industry's body image and weight issues.

5th T20I: Gill-less India flaunt all-round might, end 2025 with series victoryIND vs SA, 5th T20I: Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya struck commanding half-centuries, while spinner Varun Chakravarthy claimed four wickets as India defeated South Africa by 30 runs on Saturday to clinch the five-match T20I series 3-1.

Poll-bound Tamil Nadu sees 97 lakh names dropped from draft rolls after SIRThe Election Commission of India published Tamil Nadu's integrated draft electoral roll on December 19 after the Special Intensive Revision exercise, with several districts recording deletions, including Chennai, Coimbatore, Dindigul, Karur and Kanchipuram.

Ex-IPS officer Amitabh Thakur produced in court amid sea of copsFormer IPS officer and Azad Adhikar Sena president Amitabh Thakur was produced before a Varanasi court on Friday. Heavy security arrangements were in place, with a large contingent of police in body armour escorting him inside the court premises.

It's official. Virat Kohli will play domestic one-dayers for DelhiVirat Kohli is expected to play a couple of Vijay Hazare Trophy matches for Delhi. The Delhi state body named a 16-man squad and added Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Ishant Sharma, Harshit Rana and Navdeep Saini additionally.

Over 70 lakh names dropped in Gujarat from draft electoral rolls after SIREarlier, Gujarat had a total of 50,843,436 registered voters. After the publication of the draft electoral roll, the total number of voters came down to 43,470,109. This means that during the SIR campaign, 7,373,327 voters' names were removed from the draft electoral roll.

Deeply disturbing reality: Supreme Court lays guidelines on child trafficking casesAddressing the issue of child trafficking in India, the Supreme Court stressed the need for lower courts to approach the evidence of victims with heightened sensitivity, especially in cases involving minors from marginalised backgrounds.

No quick peace on Ukraine or Gaza, Marco Rubio says at year-end briefingUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio said peace efforts on Ukraine and Gaza face tough hurdles, defended pressure on Venezuela, and backed Trump's foreign policy overhaul during a rare, marathon year-end news conference.

sports.headline: India to announce T20 World Cup squad today. Will selectors back out-of-form Shubman Gill? Shubman Gill's role in the squad will be the main focus as India will announce their side for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Saturday, December 20. With the team also mos well-set, will the selectors throw a few curveballs at the fans with some bold choices?

Watch: Hardik applies ice pack to cameraman hit by his six in Ahmedabad T20I India vs South Africa: One of Hardik Pandya's five monstrous sixes struck a cameraman at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday. The all-rounder went over to check on him immediately after the final delivery of the match was bowled.

Surya, the batter, is missing: Captain's frank take on eve of T20 World Cup selection India captain Suryakumar Yadav delivered a blunt verdict on his own form after the South Africa series. The Indian skipper said that he went missing in action as a batter for the side during the series win against the Proteas.

When Hardik Pandya kept promise to girlfriend during the Ahmedabad blitz IND vs SA, 5th T20I: Hardik Pandya kept a promise to his girlfriend by attacking the very first ball and delivering a spectacular 63, powering India to a 3-1 T20I series victory over South Africa in Ahmedabad.

5th T20I: Gill-less India flaunt all-round might, end 2025 with series victory IND vs SA, 5th T20I: Tilak Varma and Hardik Pandya struck commanding half-centuries, while spinner Varun Chakravarthy claimed four wickets as India defeated South Africa by 30 runs on Saturday to clinch the five-match T20I series 3-1.

It's official. Virat Kohli will play domestic one-dayers for Delhi Virat Kohli is expected to play a couple of Vijay Hazare Trophy matches for Delhi. The Delhi state body named a 16-man squad and added Kohli, Rishabh Pant, Ishant Sharma, Harshit Rana and Navdeep Saini additionally.

ISL clubs propose club-owned league model, AIFF to be regulator Indian Super League clubs on Friday proposed a major overhaul of the country's top-tier football league, seeking perpetual operational and commercial rights under a club-owned model, with the AIFF continuing as the regulator.

Hardik blows kisses to Mahieka Sharma after record T20I fifty in Ahmedabad Hardik Pandya scored a sensational fifty and sent kisses to his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma after thrilling the Ahmedabad crowd during the final match of the series against South Africa on Friday, December 19.

Suryakumar dejected after another failure, ends 2025 without a single T20I fiftyIndia vs South Africa: Suryakumar Yadav cut a dejected figure after another failure with the bat in the fifth T20I, as the India captain ended 2025 without a single T20I fifty and continued his prolonged batting slump.

Amorim breaks silence on bombshell Fernandes interview, 'free Mainoo' shirtManchester United manager Ruben Amorim has broken his silence on Bruno Fernandes' comments and the controversy surrounding Kobbie Mainoo's brother wearing a 'Free Kobbie Mainoo' T-shirt ahead of the Premier League clash against Aston Villa.

Ahmedabad T20I: Abhishek misses out on Kohli's all-time record by a whiskerAbhishek Sharma missed Virat Kohli's all-time T20 record for India by a whisker as his incredible 2025 came to an end in Ahmedabad. Abhishek scored 34 off 20 balls and missed Kohli's record by 12 runs.

After dream RCB deal, Vihaan Malhotra stuns with 35-ball fifty in U19 Asia Cup semisVihaan Malhotra starred with a 35-ball fifty against Sri Lanka to guide India into the U19 Asia Cup 2025 final, just days after securing his first IPL contract with Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Why is Sanju not there? Ravi Shastri makes explosive Samson vs Gill comment on airFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri made explosive remarks on air comparing Sanju Samson and Shubman Gill as T20I openers after Samson grabbed his opportunity with both hands, producing a blistering powerplay display when he stepped in for the injured Gill in the fifth T20I against South Africa.

Sanju Samson celebrates comeback with double milestone in Ahmedabad T20IIND vs SA: Sanju Samson became the seventh Indian to reach 8,000 runs in T20 cricket and also completed 1,000 runs in T20Is during the fifth T20I on Sunday at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

How life lessons from Bhagavad Gita helped revive Ishan Kishan's careerInspired by the Bhagavad Gita, Ishan Kishan has found inner peace and adopted a more disciplined approach, which has led Jharkhand to their maiden T20 title in the Syed Mushtaq Ali tournament.

Sanju Samson finally gets his chance as injured Gill out of Ahmedabad T20ISanju Samson finally gets his chance to impress the team management and the selectors as he replaces the injured Shubman Gill for the Ahmedabad T20I against South Africa on Friday, December 19.

India set up blockbuster final vs Pakistan after 8-wicket win against Sri LankaU19 Asia Cup 2025: Ayush Mhatre's India set up a blockbuster final against Pakistan with a commanding eight-wicket win over Sri Lanka on Friday in Dubai. Pakistan handed defending champions Bangladesh an eight-wicket defeat in the other semi-final.

IPL 2026: KKR, PBKS fans rejoice as Finn Allen, Cooper Connolly set BBL on fireKKR and PBKS fans were rejoicing after their new buys Finn Allen and Cooper Connolly set the BBL stage on fire with their explosive batting for the Perth Scorchers during the match against Brisbane Heat on Friday, December 19.

Rohit Sharma not in Mumbai's VHT squad along with Yashasvi, Suryakumar: ReportRohit Sharma, Suryakumar Yadav, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shivam Dube haven't been named in Mumbai's squad for the upcoming Vijay Hazare Trophy. Rohit could still feature in the tournament once his availability is confirmed.

Suryakumar Yadav unlikely to continue as T20I captain after T20 World Cup: ReportThe BCCI is all set to announce India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad on Saturday, December 20. Captain Suryakumar Yadav, 35, is unlikely to continue beyond the biennial tournament, starting February 7 in India and Sri Lanka.

5th T20I Highlights: Varun, Bumrah fire India to 30-run win, 3-1 series winIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 5th T20I Highlights: India end 2025 with a series victory. A comprehensive 30-run win over South Africa in the series decider. Varun Chakravarthy and Jasprit Bumrah triggered the Proteas collapse. Earlier in the day, Hardik Pandya's 63 and Tilak Varma's 73 helped India post a massive total. They seal the series 3-1.

NZ vs WI: West Indies respond with strong opening stand after New Zealand declare on 575Devon Conway's career-best 227 set up New Zealand's declaration, but West Indies openers John Campbell and Brandon King responded impressively to keep their team in contention at the close of day two.

Dasun Shanaka replaces Charith Asalanka as Sri Lanka's captain for T20 World CupDasun Shanaka has been appointed captain of Sri Lanka's preliminary 25-member squad for the T20 World Cup, with Charith Asalanka stepping aside after selectors prioritised experience over recent form.

Yashasvi Jaiswal shares positive medical update from hospital after health scareIndia opener Yashasvi Jaiswal said he is recovering well after being hospitalised with severe stomach cramps following Mumbai's SMAT 2025 clash against Rajasthan on December 16 at the MCA Stadium in Pune.

ISL clubs told to submit consortium proposals as AIFF fails to get league underwayISL clubs have been asked to step in as Indian football remains stuck in limbo. With no season start date in sight, a proposed consortium may decide the league's immediate future.

Valtteri Bottas joins Adelaide crowd for Travis Head's Ashes masterclassTravis Head lit up Adelaide with a dramatic century after a dropped chance on 99, while Valtteri Bottas soaked in the Ashes atmosphere as Australia tightened their grip on the series.

Sensational Anahat Singh basks in World Cup glory, reflects on Joshna Chinappa rivalryAnahat Singh was part of a brilliant Indian team that clinched the country's maiden gold medal at the Squash World Cup, though the absence of Egypt's full-strength squad raised questions in some quarters about the credibility of the title triumph.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
